shortcuts.title: Back to normal select
content: Use W or Escape to back to normal select.

shortcuts.title: Zoom to selected (Outliner)
content: Use Numpad . to zoom to selected (outliner).

shortcuts.title: Separate by loose parts
shortcuts.shortcut: P → By Loose Parts (in Edit Mode)
content: Use P → By Loose Parts (in Edit Mode) to separate by loose parts.

shortcuts.title: Set origin to geometry
shortcuts.shortcut: Right-click → Set Origin → Origin to Geometry
content: Use Right-click → Set Origin → Origin to Geometry to set origin to geometry.

shortcuts.title: Parent to object
shortcuts.shortcut: Select children, Shift+click parent, Ctrl+P → Object
content: "Loop in parents" error = circular reference. Clear parent first with Alt+P.

shortcuts.title: Clear parent
content: "Loop in parents" error = circular reference. Clear parent first with Alt+P.

shortcuts.title: Insert keyframe
content: - Selected Channels = only what's selected in Dope Sheet
- In Active Group = specific channel group

shortcuts.title: Keyframe specific value
content: - Selected Channels = only what's selected in Dope Sheet
- In Active Group = specific channel group

shortcuts.title: Cursor to Selected
content: Note: If "Cursor to Selected" puts cursor at origin, the object's origin is at (0,0,0) but geometry is elsewhere. Go into Edit Mode, select all (A), then Shift+S → Cursor to Selected.

shortcuts.title: Selection to Cursor
content: Note: If "Cursor to Selected" puts cursor at origin, the object's origin is at (0,0,0) but geometry is elsewhere. Go into Edit Mode, select all (A), then Shift+S → Cursor to Selected.

shortcuts.title: Cursor to World Origin
content: Note: If "Cursor to Selected" puts cursor at origin, the object's origin is at (0,0,0) but geometry is elsewhere. Go into Edit Mode, select all (A), then Shift+S → Cursor to Selected.

shortcuts.title: Change Pivot Point
content: Note: If "Cursor to Selected" puts cursor at origin, the object's origin is at (0,0,0) but geometry is elsewhere. Go into Edit Mode, select all (A), then Shift+S → Cursor to Selected.

shortcuts.title: Unwrap
content: Important: Check UV Maps in Data Properties (green triangle). The "active render" camera icon must be checked, and make sure correct UV map is active (not "automap").

shortcuts.title: Smart UV Project
content: Important: Check UV Maps in Data Properties (green triangle). The "active render" camera icon must be checked, and make sure correct UV map is active (not "automap").

shortcuts.title: Instances
content: - Alt+D creates linked instance (shares mesh data)
- To verify instance: check mesh name in Object Data Properties — number shows how many objects share it
- To make instance independent: Object → Relations → Make Single User → Object & Data
- Continue instance chain with Alt+D from any instance

shortcuts.title: Toggle on/off
content: Warning: If everything moves when you move one object, proportional editing is ON. Press O to turn it off.

shortcuts.title: Modifiers & Collections
content: - Checkbox in Outliner — removes collection entirely from view layer
- Different from eye icon (hide) which is temporary

shortcuts.title: Circle around cursor
shortcuts.shortcut: Circle Select is on. Press W to exit

shortcuts.title: Everything moves together
shortcuts.shortcut: Proportional Editing is on. Press O

shortcuts.title: "Active object is not a selected mesh"
shortcuts.shortcut: Shift+click the mesh last so it's active

shortcuts.title: Instance texture not showing
shortcuts.shortcut: Check UV map active render icon in Data Properties

shortcuts.title: Toggle Edit/Object mode
content: Use Tab to toggle edit/object mode.

shortcuts.title: Wireframe view
content: Use Z → Wireframe to wireframe view.

shortcuts.title: Solid view
content: Use Z → Solid to solid view.

shortcuts.title: Repeat last action
content: Use Shift+R to repeat last action.

shortcuts.title: Fine control on values
content: Use Shift+drag to fine control on values.

shortcuts.title: Copy location between objects
content: Use Use 3D cursor method (Shift+S) to copy location between objects.

shortcuts.title: Select all in collection's children
content: Use Select objects, Shift+L → Object Data to select all in collection's children.
